monogr.title: The prisoners plaint : a sermon preached by Gualter Ashton, Master of Arts, prisoner in the Kings Bench for debt, before the imprisoned and others in that place, vpon the 25. of August. 1622
monogr.author: Ashton, Walter

div.head: THE PREFACE.
div.p: WHen the people of God were captiuated by the Babylonians, they requested them to sing some of the Songs of Sion: to which they answered, How can wee sing the Lords Song, being in a strange land, and full of heauinesse? Psal. 127. 3. 4. Mutato nomine de me narretur historia: change but the name, and the case is mine owne; They captiuated, I imprisoned; they suited to sing some of Sions Notes and Ditties, I requested (not to sing I must confesse) but to say, to speake some word of Exhortation; They answered, How can we sing the Lords Song being in a strange land, and full of heauinesse? I might haue replyed, How can a man Preach in a strange place, a house of mourning? But calling to minde, that Saint Paul, and Sylas, when they were confined, did not intermit to pray and praise the name of the Lord their God, Acts 16. v. 25. Hence haue I resolued to make their Patterne my Practise, and at this time to vndertake this dayes Taske.
